Ronét Jewelry

What: e-commerce, design, code

Ronét Jewelry is a growing small business based in Silver Spring, Maryland that wanted to expand to online sales. Online sales meant Ronét needed a website!

Renee Tatusko designs and creates handmade jewelry pieces and sells them all over the world. In order to continue expanding her business, she needed an e-commerce solution that would allow her to easily maintain the online store on her own, and also allow me to customize the site to match her unique style and create a brand. Of course, since more and more online shopping happens through mobile devices, the site needed to be responsive.

This site was built on BigCartel’s solid e-commerce solution. Their administrative system is simple and easy for Renee to use, and their default storefronts are built with modern web standards. I was also able to customize the design to my heart’s content with little time needed to get up and running, and I was able to adjust almost everything the BigCartel system to meet my customer’s needs.

Visit the site

Visit the site

Feature image Pearls waiting to be made into another beautiful handmade piece of jewelry
Source Renee Tatusko

About This Site

Behind the curtain My site is powered by Jekyll, a Ruby-based site generator that uses Liquid as its templating language. It is hosted entirely on GitHub (thanks to Kin Lane and his Hacker Storytelling for the technique!).

On stage My design was built on top of Skeleton, a bare-bones responsive framework. Fonts are Bree from Type Together, and Freight Sans from Darden Studio.
